posts.title: first little dev log
posts.summary: setting up sipbuu.me, wiring particles, neon buttons, and this json-powered blog.
posts.imageAlt: screenshot of the neon sipbuu.me homepage
content: today i finally decided to give sipbuu.me a proper landing page instead of a blank or default template.
goal: make it feel like a personal space, not a job hunt page. dark mode, neon, and a bunch of rounded corners everywhere.

content.alt: close-up of the bento grid layout

content: the blog itself is powered by /res/blog.json, which means i can just throw new entries into a json file and call it a day.

posts.title: minecraft server chaos notes
posts.summary: half devlog, half chaos log about the cbhs minecraft network and whatever i broke this week.
posts.imageAlt: stylized screenshot of the cbhs minecraft spawn area
content: the cbhs minecraft network continues to be both beautiful and mildly cursed.
i’ve been poking at plugins, configs, and validation checks to make joining feel as smooth as possible.
expect more experiments soon: custom hubs, tiny minigames, and ways to make the server feel like a weird little online campus.

posts.title: on music & pacing
posts.summary: rambling about making music at my own pace instead of trying to keep up with algorithms.
posts.imageAlt: soft abstract cover art representing quiet music
content: i make music when my brain lets me, not when the internet says i should.
sometimes that means long gaps between tracks, but i’d rather have songs that feel like me than stuff i rushed out.
this site will eventually host more of that: links to bandcamp, maybe embeds, and devlogs about the /spotify-ish project i’m messing with.
